summary.para: The Clone method copies the collection.

param.name: ppIEnumStreamIdMap
param.para: Receives a pointer to the interface of the new collection object. The caller must release the interface.

returns.para: Returns S_OK if successful. If the method fails,an HRESULT error code is returned.

summary.para: The Next method retrieves the next n elements in the collection.

param.name: cRequest
param.para: The number of elements to retrieve.

param.name: pStreamIdMap
param.para: Address of a user-allocated array containing cRequest elements that will receive the retrieved structures.

param.name: pcReceived
param.para: Receives the number of elements actually retrieved.

returns.para: Returns S_OK if successful. If the method fails,an HRESULT error code is returned.

remarks.para: If cRequest >= 0 and pcReceived is not NULL, upon return pcReceived contains the number of stream ID maps remaining in the collection.

summary.para: The Reset method moves the iterator to the beginning of the collection.

returns.para: Returns S_OK if successful. If the method fails,an HRESULT error code is returned.

summary.para: The Skip method skip the element at the specified index.

param.name: cRecords
param.para: Index of the element to skip.

returns.para: Returns S_OK if successful. If the method fails, an HRESULT error code is returned.

summary.para: The IEnumStreamIdMap interface is implemented on a standard COM collection of Stream ID maps that have been created by the MPEG-2 Demultiplexer's method. To obtain a pointer to this interface, use the method. Typically, an output pin will never have more than one stream ID mapped to it at any given time. This collection represents a snapshot of the Stream IDs mapped at the time the collection is created. The collection is not updated automatically.
